text: Human rights in Tajikistan, a country in Central Asia, have become an issue of international concern. The access to basic human rights remains limited, with corruption in the government and the systematic abuse of the human rights of its citizens slowing down the progress of democratic and social reform in the country. == LGBT rights == LGBT people tend to face frequent discrimination, harassment and violence from the authorities and the Muslim-majority public. Transgender people "face a lot of stigma and discrimination" in Tajikistan. ==References== Category:Tajikistan Tajikistan
title: Human rights in Tajikistan
